description: Elevated body temperature above normal range
basic_treatment: Rest, stay hydrated, take fever-reducing medication if temperature is high
when_to_consult: If fever persists for more than 3 days or is accompanied by severe symptoms

description: Pain or discomfort in the head or scalp
basic_treatment: Rest in a quiet, dark room, stay hydrated, take over-the-counter pain relievers
when_to_consult: If severe, sudden, or accompanied by confusion, stiff neck, or after head injury

description: Sudden expulsion of air from the lungs to clear airways
basic_treatment: Stay hydrated, use cough drops or honey (for adults), use a humidifier
when_to_consult: If persistent for more than 2 weeks, produces thick green/yellow phlegm, or causes difficulty breathing

description: Extreme tiredness resulting from mental or physical exertion
basic_treatment: Ensure adequate rest, maintain proper nutrition, engage in light physical activity
when_to_consult: If persistent and interferes with daily activities or is accompanied by other symptoms

description: Sensation of discomfort in the stomach with an urge to vomit
basic_treatment: Eat smaller meals, avoid strong odors, stay hydrated with clear fluids
when_to_consult: If severe, persistent, or accompanied by vomiting blood or severe abdominal pain

description: Feeling of not getting enough air, difficulty breathing
basic_treatment: Sit upright, practice deep breathing, use rescue medications if prescribed
when_to_consult: If sudden onset, severe, or accompanied by chest pain, immediately seek medical attention

description: Discomfort or pain in the chest area
basic_treatment: Rest, take prescribed medications for known conditions like acid reflux
when_to_consult: If sudden, severe, or accompanied by sweating, nausea, or shortness of breath, seek emergency care

description: Feeling lightheaded, unsteady, or like the room is spinning
basic_treatment: Sit or lie down safely, stay hydrated, avoid sudden movements
when_to_consult: If persistent, severe, recurrent, or accompanied by fainting or neurological symptoms

description: Pain felt between the chest and groin area
basic_treatment: Rest, over-the-counter pain relievers, avoid trigger foods
when_to_consult: If severe, persistent, or accompanied by fever, vomiting, or inability to keep food down

description: Area of irritated or swollen skin that changes its appearance or texture
basic_treatment: Avoid irritants, use mild soaps, apply over-the-counter hydrocortisone cream
when_to_consult: If covers large area, spreads rapidly, or is accompanied by fever or difficulty breathing

description: Discomfort, pain, or inflammation in any joint in the body
basic_treatment: Rest affected joints, apply ice/heat, gentle stretching, over-the-counter pain relievers
when_to_consult: If severe, accompanied by significant swelling, redness, or inability to use the joint

description: Pain, irritation, or scratchiness in the throat
basic_treatment: Gargle with warm salt water, drink warm liquids, use throat lozenges
when_to_consult: If severe, persistent for more than a week, or accompanied by high fever or difficulty swallowing

description: Pain felt anywhere along the spine or muscles in the back
basic_treatment: Rest, gentle stretching, over-the-counter pain relievers, heat/ice therapy
when_to_consult: If severe, persists more than a few weeks, or is accompanied by numbness, weakness, or fever

description: Loose, watery stools occurring more frequently than normal
basic_treatment: Stay hydrated with clear fluids, eat bland foods, avoid dairy and high-fiber foods temporarily
when_to_consult: If severe, lasts more than 2 days, or accompanied by high fever, severe abdominal pain, or bloody stools

description: Infrequent bowel movements or difficulty passing stools
basic_treatment: Increase fiber intake, stay hydrated, regular physical activity
when_to_consult: If persistent for more than 2 weeks, accompanied by severe abdominal pain, or alternating with diarrhea

description: Lack of sharpness of vision resulting in the inability to see fine details
basic_treatment: Rest eyes, ensure proper lighting, use prescribed corrective lenses
when_to_consult: If sudden onset, persistent, accompanied by eye pain, or only affecting one eye

description: Enlarged lymph nodes that may feel tender or painful
basic_treatment: Rest, over-the-counter pain relievers, warm compresses
when_to_consult: If persistent for more than 2 weeks, unexplained, or accompanied by weight loss, night sweats, or fever

description: Difficulty falling asleep or staying asleep
basic_treatment: Establish regular sleep schedule, create relaxing bedtime routine, limit caffeine and screen time before bed
when_to_consult: If chronic (lasting more than 3 months) or significantly affecting daily life

description: Reduced desire to eat for a period of time
basic_treatment: Eat smaller, more frequent meals, focus on nutrient-dense foods, stay hydrated
when_to_consult: If accompanied by significant weight loss, persistent for more than 2 weeks, or accompanied by other symptoms

description: Passing urine more often than usual
basic_treatment: Stay hydrated, avoid caffeine and alcohol, practice good hygiene
when_to_consult: If accompanied by pain during urination, blood in urine, fever, or lower abdominal pain

description: Losing significant weight without trying
basic_treatment: Ensure adequate nutrition, consult healthcare provider for proper evaluation
when_to_consult: If weight loss exceeds 5% of body weight over 6-12 months without a known reason

description: Abnormal buildup of fluid in the body's tissues, causing swelling
basic_treatment: Elevate affected area, reduce salt intake, wear compression stockings if recommended
when_to_consult: If sudden onset, painful, or accompanied by shortness of breath or chest pain

description: Yellowing of skin and whites of eyes
basic_treatment: Depends on cause; avoid alcohol and hepatotoxic medications
when_to_consult: Immediately, as jaundice indicates liver dysfunction requiring medical evaluation

description: Loss of sensation or prickling feeling in any part of the body
basic_treatment: Depends on cause; avoid pressure on affected areas, gentle stretching if nerve compression suspected
when_to_consult: If sudden onset, affects one side of the body, or is accompanied by weakness or coordination problems

description: Excessive shedding of hair from the scalp or body
basic_treatment: Gentle hair care, balanced diet rich in proteins and vitamins, stress management
when_to_consult: If sudden, patchy, or accompanied by scalp problems like itching or redness

description: Persistent, abnormal feeling of thirst even when drinking adequate fluids
basic_treatment: Stay hydrated, but seek medical attention to identify underlying cause
when_to_consult: If accompanied by frequent urination, weight loss, or extreme fatigue

description: Presence of blood in bowel movements
basic_treatment: Increase fiber and fluid intake if constipation is the cause (for hemorrhoids)
when_to_consult: Always consult a healthcare provider when blood is present in stool

description: Forceful expulsion of stomach contents through the mouth
basic_treatment: Sip clear fluids, avoid solid foods until vomiting subsides, gradually reintroduce bland foods
when_to_consult: If persistent for more than 24 hours, contains blood, or accompanied by severe abdominal pain or dehydration

description: Involuntary, rhythmic muscle contraction causing shaking
basic_treatment: Avoid caffeine and other stimulants, get adequate rest, stress management techniques
when_to_consult: If tremors interfere with daily activities or are accompanied by other neurological symptoms

description: Discomfort or burning sensation during urination
basic_treatment: Increase fluid intake, especially water, avoid irritants like caffeine and alcohol
when_to_consult: If accompanied by fever, blood in urine, or lower back pain

description: Difficulty remembering information or events
basic_treatment: Mental exercises, adequate sleep, balanced diet rich in antioxidants, omega-3 fatty acids
when_to_consult: If interfering with daily activities or worsening over time

description: Excessive sweating during sleep
basic_treatment: Sleep in cool environment, use breathable bedding, avoid triggers like alcohol or spicy foods
when_to_consult: If persistent or accompanied by fever, weight loss, or fatigue

description: Ringing or buzzing sound in one or both ears
basic_treatment: Avoid loud noises, use white noise machines, stress management techniques
when_to_consult: If sudden onset, accompanied by hearing loss, or affecting daily activities

description: Heart rhythm that is irregular, too fast, or too slow
basic_treatment: Avoid caffeine and alcohol, practice stress management, take medications as prescribed
when_to_consult: If accompanied by chest pain, shortness of breath, or dizziness, seek immediate medical attention

description: Irritating sensation that causes desire to scratch
basic_treatment: Use moisturizers, avoid hot showers, wear loose-fitting clothing, use mild soaps
when_to_consult: If widespread, severe, or accompanied by rash or yellowing of skin

description: Trouble moving food or liquid from mouth to stomach
basic_treatment: Eat slowly, take smaller bites, avoid very hot or cold foods, stay upright after meals
when_to_consult: If persistent, painful, or accompanied by weight loss or regurgitation

description: Developing bruises from minor bumps or injuries
basic_treatment: Protect vulnerable areas, ensure adequate nutrition
when_to_consult: If bruises appear without injury or are accompanied by bleeding elsewhere

description: Abnormal change in voice, making it sound breathy, raspy, or strained
basic_treatment: Rest voice, stay hydrated, avoid irritants like smoking
when_to_consult: If persists more than 2 weeks or is accompanied by pain, difficulty breathing, or trouble swallowing

description: Significant shifts in emotion or affect
basic_treatment: Regular exercise, adequate sleep, stress management techniques, social support
when_to_consult: If interfering with daily functioning or accompanied by thoughts of self-harm

description: Discomfort or pain in eyes when exposed to light
basic_treatment: Wear sunglasses, reduce screen time, use artificial tears if eyes are dry
when_to_consult: If severe, sudden onset, or accompanied by eye pain, headache, or vision changes
